linkedin_essay.text:
Winston Churchill famously quipped that ‚ÄúDemocracy is the worst form of government except for all the others that have been tried.‚Äù ¬†With this statement he was expressing a view that many share: yes, democracy has its faults, but it is better than all of the alternatives.

Churchill‚Äôs opinions carry a lot of weight. ¬†In a BBC survey of British attitudes in 2002 the British public voted Churchill as the greatest Briton to have ever lived. ¬†Presumably for his rousing speeches and defiant stand against Hitler at the beginning of the Second World War. ¬†With this level of support, verging on veneration, it is assumed by many that everything he said was equally great.

But was Churchill right? ¬†Was he right about democracy?
